radiographic_examinations.findings: Within the right lower quadrant, there is an area of inflammation centered predominantly around the posterior cecum. Multiple diverticula are noted including a diverticulum with hyperdense contents at the site of greatest inflammatory change. The appendix appears inflamed with mucosal hyperenhancement, and dilated measuring up to 7 mm. Several prominent lymph nodes are seen. No free fluid or free air is identified. The liver, spleen, pancreas, bilateral adrenal glands, and left kidney appear unremarkable.
